intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius brachiatum subsp. erythromnoum, commonly known as the red-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its reddish stems and slightly hairy foliage, contributing to its ecological and botanical significance.
